0.cdata!:
Le royaume du Maroc - el rapport
            d'achevement sur le projet de lutte contre la secheresse

abstracts.cdata!:
The performance of the World Bank was
            speedy and highly satisfactory, with borrower performance
            matching that of the Bank's. The overall outcome was
            excellent not only in terms of mitigating the crisis, but
            also in establishing benchmarks and strategies to face
            future droughts. First, a panel of experts, chosen from
            throughout the Bank, reviewed project documents and met
            regularly with the task team. Second, the components were
            chosen from priority lists for which studies and other
            documentation were already available. Third, the government
            pre-financed contracts. Fourth, the project benefited from a
            flexible design, where procedures were adapted to the
            emergency nature of the operation. Fifth, the executing
            agencies reacted quickly and efficiently. Sixth, the
            Ministry of Finance was a close partner in designing and
            preparing the project and was the executing agency which
            made sure the necessary budget was allocated in time. At the
            sectoral level, the national livestock inventory was
            maintained to allow a quick reconstitution of the herds
            after the drought; and the price of animal feed and
            livestock products was stabilized and a regular market
            supply insured. The government quickly exempted animal feed
            imports from taxes and advanced funds for efficient feed
            distribution and construction of water points. The Ministry
            of Finance subsidized farmers for the higher seed prices.
            Finally, the sustainability of community-based systems was
            greatly enhanced by being demand-based.
